Luetzow Travelogue from the Hisham Khatib Collection AD.MC.030_ref149Collection processed by Jasmine Soliman for Akkasah: Center for Photography at NYUAD New York University Abu Dhabi LibraryAbuDhabiThis finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace 2020-04-06T13:08:59eng
New York University Abu Dhabi Library
S.S. Luetzow Travelogue - Hisham Khatib Collection.
Khatib, Hisham, Mr.
AD.MC.030_ref149
52 Leaves - One album with string ties, containing 49 pages. Eight postcards and ship menus, forty gelatin silver photographs.
1930s Generally good, some brittle and warped. A photographic travelogue of a voyage taken on the S.S. Luetzow, second oriental cruise run by Norddeutscher Lloyd Bremen in April and May 1930 beginning at Venice, stopping at Istanbul, Athens, Palestine and Egypt, with handwritten notes in German.
The Hisham Khatib Collection on the Holy Land and region is one of the largest collections of Middle Eastern photography still in private hands. It contains hundreds of 19th century original albumen photographic prints as well as many travel albums of the same period and early 20th century with hundreds of black and white photographs and postcards. The collection contains photography from dozens of photographers, but the albumen prints are mostly the work of the Bonfils family, Francis Frith, Francis Bedford, Matson photo Service, American Colony, Zangaki Brothers, and Frank Mason Good. Dr. Hisham Khatib has spent over 40 years amassing a vast and historically valuable collection of representations of the Near East, including the Holy Lands, including Palestine, Jordan, Turkey, Syria and Egypt. The artworks in this extraordinary collection include paintings, prints, maps, books, photographs, as well as postcards. A large part of Dr. Khatib's collection consists of rare photographic prints: he has over 3,000 images. See main collection http://dlib.nyu.edu/findingaids/html/akkasah/ad_mc_030/ Digital Copy Only 030_ref149
Content Description
A photographic travelogue of a voyage taken on the S.S. Luetzow, second oriental cruise run by Norddeutscher Lloyd Bremen in April and May 1930 beginning at Venice, stopping at Istanbul, Athens, Palestine and Egypt, with handwritten notes in German.
Part of the Hisham Khatib Collection which contains 2,930 photographs and postcards (both individual prints and contained within albums) focussed on the Near East, including the Holy Land, Palestine, Jordan, Turkey, Syria and Egypt as well as a very small number from Europe.
Biographical / Historical
A photographic travelogue of a voyage taken on the S.S. Luetzow, second oriental cruise run by Norddeutscher Lloyd Bremen in April and May 1930. Part of the larger Hisham Khatib Collection.
Conditions Governing Use
Any rights (including copyright and related rights to publicity and privacy) held by Dr. Hisham Khatib are maintained by New York University. Permission to publish or reproduce materials in this collection must be secured from repository. Please contact Akkasah at akkasah@nyu.edu
Conditions Governing Access
Materials are open without restrictions.
